instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short circuit
threads.message:
hello i have <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> there is no sign of water damage 
i found the <CAPACITOR>C7261</CAPACITOR> is burnt (<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>)  after i removed this capacitor the value is 0.171 4.0v-5.0v looping
still no chime no fan spin still cant on. 
i also diode test L7310 and L7320 0.011 with 0.0v
so is it cpu spoil already or still got another way need to check. 
thanks in advance

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short circuit
threads.message:
CPU shouldn't be affected by shorted cap in <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Check fuse F7140, if not open.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short circuit
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 78419, member: 682"]
Check fuse F7140
[/QUOTE]

problem solved jump f1740. thanks [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER]   ?  :)
